comments.body:
could be good to test a polymorphic refinement, which is allowed if it is not structural:
```scala
trait PolyHolder {
  def foo[T](t: T): Any
}

...

def m4(x: PolyHolder { def foo[T](t: T): T }) = ???
```

btw, the refinements are printed as empty if the refinement type is the result of a polymorphic method:
```scala
def m5[Z](x: Int): PolyHolder { def foo[T](t: T): T } = ???
```

prints as
```
method m5 [typeparam Z ](param x: Int): PolyHolder {}
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +3,7 @@def m1(a: Int { val x: Int }) = ???
def m2(x: { val x: Int; def y: Int }) = ???
def m3(x: { val x: Int; def y: Int; type z }) = ???
trait PolyHolder {
  def foo[T](t: T): Any
